description: From Latin dīverticulum, alternative form of dēverticulum (“byroad; deviation”), from dēvertō (“turn away, turn aside”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) A small out-pouching of an organ wall such as the large intestine or urinary bladder.
examples: Diverticula are small, light-bulb-shaped pouches in the bowel wall, resulting from the tissue in the gut bulging outwards under pressure.
